results.title: Hunting a kangaroo
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Alcheringa (A)”.
Shows First nations people out hunting for an important source of food, the kangaroo; using boomerang and woomera which are made especially for the purpose. Introduced by Bill Onus and narrated by John Morgan.

results.title: Fishing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Alcheringa”.
Illustrates the fishing methods of some Australian First Nations people, shown fishing on a lake using three-pronged spears from bark canoes. With Bill Onus.

results.title: Emu hunt
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Alcheringa”.
Hunting for the emu. Two men after finding eggs follow the spoor across the desert, with their spears held ready to catch their prey.

results.title: Boomerang
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alcheringa”.
Demonstrates how a boomerang is made. The diligent search for the exact right piece of wood, the burning off of the outer bark, the laborious whittling with a sharpened stone and the fashioning of the slight twist at each end to achieve its unique quality of returning to its point of departure. Introduced by Bill Onus.

results.title: Bark canoe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Alcheringa”.
Shows the methods of canoe manufacture employed by some Australian First Nations peoples. Illustrates the removal of bark from a tree in a single section, its shaping and testing, and finally the canoe’s use for fishing. Introduced by Bill Onus.

results.title: Gurrawilla
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell, Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alan Marshall: author and man”.
At one time, Marshall lived with First Nations people in Arnhem Land, and he tells us how he became known as ‘Gurrawilla’. He also describes in a light-hearted manner tales of his childhood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ross Campbell, Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: On writing
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell, Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Alexander Milsky
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Alan Marshall: author and man”.
Though afflicted by sickness and suffering at an early age, Marshall had a happy childhood. He began to write at the age of ten. He read widely and was influenced by various authors, though his stories usually begin from small everyday incidents or remarks. He offers some advice to young writers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ross Campbell, Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Alexander Milsky

results.title: Life and influences
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alan Marshall: author and man”.
Alan Marshall describes his early life, the loneliness because of his handicap, and how he overcame this by faith and determination. He tells in an amusing way how people and incidents gave him a store of material that inspired his creative ability, and shaped his philosophy.
